result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brenda A Miller

records.addlTxt:
(11:14 AM case called.) Defendant Brenda A Miller in court without counsel. Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court orders the warrant is quashed and bond continues.
Defendant advised of right to an attorney. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on November 7, 2022 at 3:15 pm.
Hearing scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:26 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Brenda A Miller not in court. State requests warrant.

Warrant ordered.

Conditions:
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.

(11:40 AM case called.) Defendant Brenda A Miller appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Sonia L Anderson appeared by video for Brenda A Miller. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint.
Attorney Anderson advises the defendant didn't apply for Public Defender representation.
Defendant updates address and phone number with the Court.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on September 14, 2022 at 1:30 pm.
Hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
